description: This app works Great... love this email client!!

this is a great tool to check mails, i have 3 accounts being synchronized using this app. I love the interface and a lot other features that Mailspring provides. 
The search tool is efficient, a few themes are really good.
A few suggestions:
1. the app has been frequently crrashing, please continue to update more frequently.
2. can we have an option to set how many emails to download , eg 30 days, 15 days, etc or the limit to the total cache size.

This a very good looking application that i have ever discover
but currently i'm facing issue with with connecting gmail account i see on the screen that this app is blocked this should be resolved but this app is awesome.
summary: This a very good looking application that i have ever discover

description: Showed nothing in my inbox where I definately have mail.
It sends everything twice or even three times. Please fix the bug and I will re-install.
Slower, sends the emails twice or thrice. Some features are really good like snoozing, reminder etc
amazing open source project
MailSpring is my to go email app for nearly a month, and it has not yet disappointed me. Great work dev.
summary: Great App ! Does everything that is promises

description: Easy installation , Good UI , can choose with different themes , can even track emails . Highly recommended .

This mail client is so good, that I would say its even better than Outlook 2019! It has some caveats, but its an excellent mail client. It's so good, on Windows, I'd still prefer to use this as it offers some incredible features. I hope the development for this project continues!
Best mail client for linux
I had to re-write so many emails because of sudden crushes. UX is nice, some features are also nice.
summary: Has great potential, but also terrible bugs

description: I CANT SEE THE SENT MAILS FROM THE MAILSPRING
Says that a custom smtp port may be entered, but apparently not enough room in the field; i.e. no go
I did not like the fact that it Requires a MailSpring account

This app works like butter, is packed with cool features and UI, and I have not yet found a single major bug. I love everything about it, including the "unread" tab which lets my just find all the unread emails without having to sift through them. It supports Gmail features nicely, like personal level indicator, and even has some awesome ones like "open and link tracker," which tells you whenever someone opens and email you sent, or opens a link in it. Very cool.

The ONLY thing I have a problem with is that on occasion, the spell checker goes a little crazy and marks almost every word as wrong. A fix on this would be nice.
This app does have a "premium" you can pay for, but thankfully, I have not found much that this limits you on (this is what I'd expect from Ubuntu software). They do have a cool feature where it'll take a contact you add and search the web for details about them on social media or something, and you have to get premium for more than the sample allotment of contacts. Premium gets you some things like that.

Great app! Much appreciated!
I switched to this from web-based email and couldn't be happier. It's really well made, most all the features I want and gets out of the way.
Forced to use online account. No thanks.
Good looking and easy to use.

This app requires ID in the developers website. Meaning we would need to share our user/pass with them.

I would pass !
This app only supports HTML email.
I really love this app..Its simple yet does a great job.
summary: By far the best mail service i have used

description: Right amount of features and it also wins "best looking e-mail client".
summary: For me, it's the number one Linux e-mail client I would recommend

description: The signature are pretty much locked down to what THEY want. Sad. I was liking it until I went to add my signature.
summary: This would have been my choice... BUT..

description: The UI is superb and modern. Supports a lot of mail server.
Would hit upto 100% CPU usage even when closed.

I love the UI, but, significant bugs with connectivity persist. I had to frequently rebuild my mailbox. At the end it did not save a draft because it had yet again lost the connection. That was the last straw.
summary: This app was terrible and is no uninstalled

description: It is working very nicely until now.
gives you a lot for no money
summary: pretty good, nothing to complain about!

description: absolutely good
looks and feel of the app is great
I'm far from the only person who doesn't like the idea of being force to sign up for an online account to use a desktop mail client.
summary: A desktop app that requires an online account

description: Requires to create mailspring account
sangat memudahkan
It does have some great features. But my biggest issue is not being able to back up my preferences. Come on! That should be a gimme!
Literally the only thing that annoys me about this app is the fact that the usual window placement controls just don't work for it.
summary: Pretty good feature set. Window management frustrating

description: Every time I opened Mailspring I had to reconnect my Gmail accounts through my browser. Kinda misses the point of using a non-browser email client. It's off my system now.
This app allows me to handle my daily tasks with tremendous ease. Especially the custom shortcuts and mail tracking gives you a boost in replying and answering the most important mails first.
I did not like the fact that it Requires a MailSpring account
summary: need to create account before use

description: wonderful App, clean look, well designed, pleasant interface, excellent work

1. Only html format for messages
2. Change links inside message body to some referral links through mailspring servers. Recipients told that theirs av and junk filters suggest all this messages as suspicious. 

Remove it. Perfect client, but this is not acceptable
That's awsome!

I love the Mailspring app because the free version provides you with an elegant, fast, and modern interface. The premium version (which Mailspring doesn't pester you to buy like some applications) adds even more great functionality for a great price without removing any expected features from the free version. Definitely recommend!

I understand the limitations of the free versions but the UI felt laggy ad sometimes I couldn't click the [OK] button on some dialogs.

The account limit on the free version is really not good. Uninstalling.
I love how it is just a mail client. It does not make you feel overwhelmed by a lot of options. Also the design is very clean.
New, fresh and extremely useful mail client for linux!
Just switched over to MS from Evo. running on PopOS 19! its amazing! can't wait for the calendar feature...
It won't open. I only got to open it once.
Great design, lots of useful and exclusive features. Still sends things twice or thrice.
stupid...
I am a new linux user and this software is really cool. I am now a days not checking my mails on my mobile but on my laptop while doing studies and all. this is really cool software.
summary: very cool UI and rich features

description: great multiplatform mail client.
Mailspring is without a doubt the best email application for Linux. It provides every feature you could want from one and more in a clean, organized fashion that makes managing emails a breeze.
summary: Excellent email app... Best for Linux!

description: Seems fairly impossible that its difficult to make the 3rd party sign in optional... So I really don't trust an application that forces users to make themselves identifiable for no reason.
summary: Non-optional 3rd party sign in to use the application..

description: The app itself has a great interface and is a pleasure to use - when it's not hogging your CPU syncing with an IMAP server. A large inbox, after several days, never completed syncing and slowed my computer to a point of no return. Sent several messages to MailSpring support but never got a response. As well, there is nothing in the app for Contacts other than its build in database. It really needs CardDAV connectivity. I hope they fix the issues with IMAP syncing and add some connectivity for contacts in the future. Would like to give the app another try.
summary: Great interface but a resource hog. No connection to Contacts

description: Failed for 163.
Looks good, but I kept having to re-authenticate
summary: Looks good, but I kept having to re-authenticate

description: I have to create account for using the app which is not acceptable
Nice smooth UI, good features. Thanks!
Beautful UI and very good features for every day uses, thanks!!

Worked fine for months. Then it said it was out of sync with my email accounts and wouldn't let me re-authenticate. Removed my email accounts and tried to set them up again. Signed in under my mailspring account (which you have to make) and it only gave me the option to reset my email, reset my password, delete my mailspring account, or upgrade to pro. No option to actually use email. All I could do was sign in and manage an account that did nothing.

Honestly, one of the easiest and best email clients on Linux. Similar to Spark, which is a great iOS/Mac mail client. It works amazing for linux. If you're planning on using this for multi-platform, it's available for Mac OS, but that version is a little buggy.
Having to create another just to use the email client, in addition to your email accounts makes this one to avoid

I really like it, the look, the options, and that it better integration with themes than some other clients. But the one drawback, for me at least, is that it doesn't play nicely with my PIA VPN client. It just keeps checking mail and it never tells you what's wrong. I found out by accident that it was the VPN client. Now, it *could* be my mail server that is doing this so I'm not going to ding them a star.
summary: Great client unless you use a VPN

description: This app is giving you lots of flexibility to use your several emails at same time. After using a macbook laptop, It found the best app for emails on ubuntu operating system.
it is the best app out there in linux and i want you to know that you will not be dissapointed while installing this app..
summary: loved it man so easy to use

description:
Beautiful interface

Still has problems
1) I DO NOT WANT ANOTHER BL+=£% ACCOUNT! Literally the moment a reasonable alternative arrives - This will be the reason I move over
1) Contacts is a MESS. It doesn't sync properly
2)Opening mail in a new window is broken
What a fatal bug.........it sends all the email twice.....please fix........................................

Have been using it for over one year and has everything I wanted.
Out of the box support for all the mainstream mail providers, with little to no configuration required.
A must try email client for users who are switching from windows to ubuntu.
Version updated yesterday doesn't include signature in new mails and switches to a font that is much too big and ugly. Too bad, hope it ca be fixed soon.
summary: Good app, latest version doesn't include signature in new mails

description: the only connectivity to exchange online / office 365 is via IMAP, which is not a valid option in this day and age. Without support for EWS and "modern authentication" including MFA, this product is simply not viable for exchange online users with any concern for email security.
Generated the password to get over the two step authentication, started to load, but sticks in a white screen until I have to just close it. Back to Thunderbird Mail unfortunately.
was just setting up my IMAP/SMTP email, finished entering the credentials, then.. just blank white box. same thing happened on an Office 365 account.

When adding Office 365 account, white screen hangs forever. Error in console: Cannot read property 'emailAddress' of undefined

https://github.com/Foundry376/Mailspring/issues/112
summary: Doesn't work on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS when adding Office 365 -

description: It doesn't work with microsoft outlook. It either doesn't add a new account, if I had already added a different email form gmail for example, or it just crashs, if the only email is an outlook email. Besides, the 2FA authentication doesn't work at all
The mail client kept on crashing. The program acted extremely buggy. Too bad becauseI like the UX
Never brings up anything...just a white window.
sleek simple and userfriendly
summary: recommended to use it in any platform. best for linux

description: Tried both office 365 and generic IMAP- It says "Success" then the window turns blank white and nothing happens. This is a known issue: https://github.com/Foundry376/Mailspring/issues/1847

Fails to connect to imap server:

Gets stuck in a 'sync forever' cycle. Try it out, it looks nice maybe it'll work, it didn't for me. Also there is a paywall for certain features
summary: Can't sync with Gmail making it pretty pointless as a news reader

description: I don't believe how anyone would enter his/her emailcredentials in an app that is linked with an online account. You have NO idea whatsoever what the authors are doing with your mail.

The app runs in background and I have to kill it very often because it takes up to 20% of my CPU workload... Uninstalled without even using it. The UI looks great but I can't accept that my PC gets hot just because of a buggy email client.
if ur using emails frequently u should check it out.

The tool itself is nice, however, it lacks certain features. For instance it is difficult to create mail rules, you cannot move mails (by rule) from one account to another etc.. Furthermore I think that the search feature is not very well-implemented - too many times I had to manually search for something, which in Thunderbird I found easily via the search bar - in that sense, improving the fuzzy-search would improve the whole tool a lot.

Lots of good candidates but Mailspring looks smooth, works great and is generally a solid e-mail client. Very similar to Apple Mail, which in this instance is very positive. The added tracking feature is a nice bonus. This app deserves 5+ stars.
There is a signup process that looks like it's setting up your email and it asks for your email and password the same as you'd expect thunderbird to set your server. quite missleading
I've not seen a better one, open-source or otherwise, for connecting to Gmail/GSuite
Forces the user to create an account. Uninstalled it.
summary: Forces the user to create an account

description: version 1.7.4 not supported for xubuntu

after succesful configuring imap / smtp, application show a blank page. nothing happen.

After I close and run the application again, I need to setup imap / smtp again.

I repeated few times, still not working.
I used to love this software, when i came back to ubuntu i tried to use it again, but when i log-in into my Mailspring account, and then on my email account it just shows a white box, nothing else
summary: Not opening, only a white box

description:
I installed Mailspring as a replacement for the default Thunderbird.
Added my 2 Gmail Accounts and it worked.
As soon as I tried to add my personal t-online Account, I was only promted to give my Email and my Password. So I did, but then the window closed and nothing happened. I couldn't even set my IMAP-Settings.
Conclusio: fine for google mail, not however if you want to use T-Online mail service.
It maybe nice application but I've removed that 1 min after installation. A reason? I'm just not going to create an account that I don't need to read my email.

The minute you sign on, you're asked for your login information. Once provided and verified, the App just hangs. There is no sign on whatsoever. I've quit the app 5x already and tried to reboot and start process again only to have it exhibit the same behavior.

Mailspring is a very good email app for Ubuntu. One of the reasons why I love it is becuase everything is easy to use. I had not experienced any lags or slow downs. Everything is resposive and works like it should.
Really great UI, should definitely give it a try.
Really good email app for Ubuntu. I have nothing else to really say!

unreliable at best
cannot load multiple email accounts
freezes desktop environment
seek another solution, mailspring solves very little imho
Endlich ein E-Mail Programm mit einem Outlook Feeling. Einfache Einrichtung, alle Funktionen die man braucht und vor allem macht es einen ordentlichen Eindruck
summary: Das Beste E-Mail Programm unter Linux

description:
I really like Mailspring - i like it more than thunderbird for home-usage. the mail - tracking feature is quiete useful.

the only problem i have, is that the snap version with manjaro linux does have some bugs with email notifications. (kde). i can see the tray icon, 90% of the time it turns blue (indicates that there is a new mail) but no mail was delivered. also there is no sound for incoming emails on both of my machines. the other "problem" is, that if i close the programm (instead of minimizing it) - the systray icon stays, but it never shows any incoming email until i manually reopen the program.

but overall, mailspring is fast and beautiful.
Not all parts of Mailspring are open source. And you need to create a Mailspring Account to use it.
hjzjnmfjmhjztjztz
... i do not like the need of an id.
Zwangsregistrierung für einen Email Client. Sorry, so nicht.

- No calendar so far
- No chance to change column width in Inbox or any other folder
- Haven't found a possibility to deactivate threaded view

Liked the signature functionality though.
Uses way too much resources for just a mail app
Total schlechtes Programm

Wen das Erstellen eines Accounts stört, der wird hier natürlich nicht glücklich. Das Userinterface und Funktionalität in Bezug auf Einfachheit ist anderen Clients im Store jedoch weit überlegen. 
Leider funktioniert die Outlook-Synchronisierung derzeit nicht 100% sonst gäbe es 5 Sterne von mir.

Using multiple mail accounts for work purposes, I need a reliable solution. I've tried Geary, Evolution and Thunderbird but I felt most comfortable with Mailspring. It's easy to use, meaning intuitive, stable and has some essential features that some others are missing:
- Working HTML signatures
- Safly store drafts on the server (geary loses me wirtten mails multiple times :/ )
- Sending with a timed offset.

Despite that, I dislike the need of an account and the fact that it's not open source. But hence I need to get things done, I favour this app.
Alles funzt wie gewünscht, ohne irgendwelche Probleme. Nur die zwangsregestrierung ist unötig.

Just dont work. Cant access IMAP.
Changes on IMAP causes crash. Need external ID
Andere Mailprogramme unter Linux sind oft ein Krampf, Mailspring ist eine gutes Programm, die Datenschutzrichtlinien gehen aus meiner Sicht in Ordnung. Leider dennoch immer wieder auch buggy.

unübersichtliches Mailprogramm.
strg-a mehrfach Auswahl um 50 Maols und mehr zu löschen,Fehlanzeige.
Ferner werden als Spam markierte mails immer wieder angezeigt.
Gleich wieder deinstalliert.
summary: Zwang zur Registrierung einer komischen ID

description:
deb.-file hier: https://getmailspring.com/download
Zum Thema ID: Wem das nicht passt, einfach nicht installieren. Andererseits dann auch die Freizügigkeit seiner Daten in facebook, WhatsApp & Co überdenken...
Zur App: Einfache und sehr schnelle Konfiguration, modern und fortschrittlich. Da ist Thunderbird noch Jahre entfernt und wird es wohl noch lange bleiben.

Endlich mal ein zeitgemäßer E-Mail Client für Linux. Schluss mit dem altbackenen Design und völlig überladenen Benutzeroberflächen wie Thunderbird oder KMail... 
Man muss keinen Accoutn erstellen, lesen hilft bei der ersten Installation. Und ob es OpenSource ist, ist jedem halbwegs modernen Menschen egal. Was interessiert mich der Quellcode einer App, ich bin Enduser, kein Entwickler.

läuft nicht keine anmeldung möglich 
schrott
Keine intuitive Bedienung. Beim Einfügen durch Copy/Paste seltsames Verhalten. Über mehrere Monate hinweg verwendet, werde es jetzt aber löschen, da es mich überhaupt nicht überzeugt.
Vale la pena y es muy versatil!!
No podría ser mejor.

A diferencia de Thunderbird, ésta trae consigo la posibilidad de unificar todas las bandejas de entrada en una sola, con lo que es mucho más fácil gestionar tu correo. Es ideal para quienes tenemos muchas direcciones de correo.

Quizás tenga el defecto de no tener corrector ortográfico integrado. Pero eso es lo de menos. Cumple su función de sobra.
summary: Mucho mejor que cualquier otra app

description: Es muy bueno, lo que no me gusta es que configuro las dimenciones de la ventana, pero cuando lo vuelvo a abrir se pone normal de nuevo
If you value you or your company's privacy stay the hell away from this app
Por alguna mala configuración me ha borrado muchos mensajes, vuelvo a thunderbird
summary: Es bonita y fácil de usar

description: Es el mejor cliente de E-Mail que he probado, muy recomendable.
Al app no inicia

Es una excelente aplicación, la he usado desde hace años pero acabo de formatear un equipo con Ubuntu 18.04LTS y al dar de alta el correo de mi empresa se queda la pantalla en blanco y no sale de ahi, intenté con mi cuenta de gmail y no hubo problema pero con la cuenta de la empresa es imposible, aclaro que este problema es reciente, nunca antes tuve mayores inconvenientes con la aplicación.
Espero lo solucionen pronto !
summary: No puedo accesar a mi cuenta

description: tengo 2 cuentas, una con gmail y otra con hotmail. pero con HOTMAIL NO FUNCIONA
La mejor que he usado, simplemente la mejor :D

La aplicación es buenísima, un poco pesada. Algo muy bueno: no sé cómo, pero te avisa cuándo la otra persona lee tu mail, algo muy útil. Lástima el error recurrente de que muchas veces envía mis respuestas por duplicado.
Doesn't wok on ubuntu 18.04
Me ha servido de utilidad por su versatilidad, la unificacion que tiene y muchas cosas mas
Muy buena la verdad, me da muchas opciones como hacer que me vuelva a recordar un correo!
summary: La recomiendo! Muy buena la verdad y su interfaz amigable

description: Cumple todo lo que necesito, es sencilla, limpia, rápida
Desde que la conoci no quiero saber de ninguna otra

Tras haber intentado usar Geary (porque me parecía mejor en la integración con Gnome, Ubuntu, etc.) le encontré limitaciones (no cargaba algunos correos, tardaba en buscar, etc.) instalé Mailspring y no tengo ninguno de esos inconvenientes. Es rápida y maneja bien las 2 cuentas que uso. Muy cómoda.
Acabo de instalarla y me gusta mucho su diseño y practicidad, veremos como anda, pero de momento se ve muy bien.
summary: Me gusto su diseño y facilidad de uso

description:
No voy a escribir una reseña como tal, pero: ¿De donde demonios sacáis que la licencia es privativa? La licencia lleva siendo GPLv3 5 años. ¡¡A ver si actualizais!!

https://github.com/Foundry376/Mailspring/blob/master/LICENSE.md
summary: La licencia NO ES LA QUE PONE

description: Es la mejor aplicación, tiene tantas funciones que después de probar con thunderbird y geary, me quedé con esta sin pensarlo.

Es mi cliente de correo favorita en Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, un diseño muy cuidado y una bandeja de correo bien organizada, Ojalá fuera un poco más práctica la visualización de los correos con respuestas, pero realmente es buenísima, recomendada.
No guardó ningún mensaje envíado. Los perdí todos. Cuando los fui a buscar me di cuentas de la que me hizo.
Malísimo. No funciona con HOTMAIL
Practical, intuitive, powerful and beautiful! Is Stunning!
Mailspring es el mejor cliente de correo que he probado hasta la fecha con funcionalidades inimaginables en el resto. Descárgala y úsala, te va a enamorar.
summary: Es el mejor cliente de correo electrónico que existe en entornos Linux

description: Es funcional, esteticamente muy agradable, pero muy basica en las posibilidades de configuracion. Por ejemplo, no permitiendo modificar la vista de los correos de conversaciones a la tradicional.

summary: Bonita, fácil de usar. Funcionaba muy bien con Office365

description: No solo se trata de las opciones visuales y de personalización disponibles. Opciones como la de traducir y ver cuando han visto tu correo, hacen de esta aplicación el mejor cliente de correo electrónico que he usado. +10
summary: El mejor cliente de correo que he tenido

description: Es bonita y rapida

Intenta parecerse a Outlook y no lo veo mal, el problema es que le faltan un par de cosas...
La bandeja de entrada no es posible verla como un directorio y tampoco tiene sección de favoritos en la barra izquierda.
La barra de la derecha me pareció un poco de más.

Aun así en apariencia es mejor que Thunderbird, no entiendo por qué se empeña en preservar la apariencia más antigua, le daré seguimiento a ambos :D
es rapido, confiable, minimalista, util, adaptable y demas, cumple con todo lo nesesario
estuve usando thunderbird desde que instalè Linux, y el programa tildaba la laptop al punto de quedar completamente congelada, con Mailspring se acabò este problema
summary: Aplicaciòn sencilla de usar y muy ligera

description: Error con cuentas office365

La versión de Flatpak raramente no me había funcionado pero la versión de Snap sí me funcionó, si no les funciona a ustedes la version de Snap traten de desinstalarlo, escribir "sudo apt install gnome-keyring" en la terminal, y volver a instalar Mailspring y les debería funcionar.

Estoy en KDE neon.
summary: La versión de Flatpak no me funcionó

summary: El mailsping se desconecta y reconecta con office 365, es inestable

description: Lo unico malo es que la opcion grautita tiene un limite de buzones, fuera de eso me parece la mejor opcion.
Interfaz cómodo. Funciona bien. Estoy muy conforme. Muchas gracias
el dia de hoy no he podido abrir en todo el dia, se queda pensando sin ternimar de abrir y no hace mas nada, la desinstale y volvi a instalar y sigue igual
Andaba muy bien
summary: Todo bien hasta hoy que dejo de funcionar

description: Suele funcionar de forma aceptable, pero el día de hoy dejo de funcionar
summary: Suele funcionar bien pero hoy dejo de funcionar

description: Con la nueva actualización dejó de funcionar. Desinstalé, volví a instalar y nada, incluso instalé el paquete .deb, pero tampoco abre la aplicación.
muy buena y muy facil de usar y facil de iniciar sesion
al tratar de enviar se congela la aplicacion

es un excelente lector de correo, permite integrar varias cuentas en una sola bandeja, y está muy bien pensado para que sea fácil de usar y configurar, tiene limitaciones para las que hay que pagar pero eso es así, yo lo uso para mis dos cuentas selectas y súper feliz

Probablemente el cliente de email mas bonito para linux, puedes manejar todos tus emails en una aplicacíon; sin embargo, a mi me da problemas de sincronización muy seguido por lo que es una buena aplicacion con un problema critico. 
Espero que en el futuro lo arreglen.
Cette application est vraiment le meilleur logiciel de gestion de boites mails que j'ai pu tester sur linux. L'interface est de plus très agréable à utiliser. Je recommande !

L'application n'est pas convaincante pour passer au payant. Or, en tant qu'utilisateur professionnel, je suis toujours à la recherche de quelque chose de mieux que Thunderbird et de Outlook.
Trop de bugs notamment en ce qui concerne la gestion des adresses gmail (synchro etc).
summary: Très belle présentation mais promesses non tenues

description:
Une excellente alternative pour Outlook. Interface très agréable, riche en fonctionnalités. Je l'utilise en monde professionnel. Seul inconvénient, c'est les 8€ à payer tous les mois... 5€ c'est très bien pour les fonctionnalités avancées.

Je le recommande FORTEMENT
summary: Le meilleur client email à ce jour

description:
When asked if I want to translate from x to y, I click Options, and say "never". A modal pops up. "Are you sure?" I click "Yes"...and nothing happens. I then try to switch to another application. Nothing. I try closing Mailspring. Nothing.

Eventually I am forced to bounce the machine and lose everything in a forced restart. Fun times.
summary: Pretty, But Freezes Entire System With Non-Responsive Modal Dialog Box

description: pourris ne se connecte pas a outlook

Version free installée. 
Au début "tout nouveau tout beau".
Mais à l'utilisation bof ...
On atteint vite les limites. (ergonomie pas si terrible que ça, déconnexion/reconnexion fréquentes, limites des boites, etc ...)
Peut-être que la version payante est mieux, mais une rente mensuelle pour une messagerie faut pas pousser quand-même
Je suis revenu à Thunderbird et c'est bien mieux comme ça

je n'arrive pas a installer plusieures messageries sur la version 7.1.4d aider moi

Au dela de ca j'adore cette app

Réclame de sécurisé le mot de passe sur un monoposte monoutilisateur. 
Retour à Thunderbird
Please stop with yours wonderfull features and just focus on send mails!
Je l'utilise depuis plusieurs années, toujours au top.
A chaque ouverture de cession il faut entrer le mot de passe utilisateur du PC sinon rien ne fonctionne. Pas très pratique...
summary: Réclame le code sécurité à chaque connexion

description:
+ : simple à utiliser, puissante, et boite aux lettres unique. 
- : dommage que pour utiliser la version snap, il faut, sous KDE, installer un paquet supplémentaire en ligne de commande

- Bugs
- Fonctionalités demandées mais jamai implémentées
- UI qui n'est pas asez personalissable
- etc

Dommage, je reste avec Thunderbird et/ou GMail, qui font bien le job.
summary: Pas dédie à une utilisation pro. :(

description: Voici une application qui m'a rapidement conquise et que je commence à déployer sur mes différents objets, le dernier en date, mon OS Zorin et là, 1ère et seule galère pour le moment, lorsque je suis dans nouveau mail et que je veux ajouter une pièce jointe, une fenêtre popup s'ouvre et tout le texte est illisible... même en revenant sur l'anglais. J'espère qu'en écrivant cet avis, cela permettra de résoudre ça et rendre complètement conquis !!
De loin la meilleure application pour les mails ! Je recommande !
Pour une fois un client mail est joli et fluide tout en ayant toutes les fonctionnalités qu'on attend de lui!

Vraiment j'ai beaucoup aimé l'interface mais le compte Office 365 ne s'ouvre pas !

Merci de vérifier.
Ne démarre pas ???
Fait complètement planter l'ordinateur. Impossible à utiliser.

La connexion OAuth2 au compte Microsoft (adresses mail Live) ne fonctionne pas
La connexion IMAP sur une adresse OVH ne trouve pas le dossier Inbox

GMail ok, Hotmail ok, Orange ok
Интерфейс красивый, но програмка умеет только получить почту и еще пару фишек, полноценного управления большим кол-вом писем тут нет.

Нельзя отметить как прочитанные все непрочитанные в какой-то папке.
Просто УБОГО тормозит. У меня 2 учетки прикреплено и я банально с первого раза не могу дописать ответ на письмо. Возможно у меня, конечно много писем, но камон, 250 непрочитанных в одной учетке и 5 активных писем в другой, это много? Причем в винде такая же фигня!

В общем, если с первой проблемой можно побороться - зажать shift и попбегать по непрочитанным, то со второй просто тяжело жить.
А сам клиент хороший и функций много и красивы, в отличае от многох. Ребята почините стабильность, сильно вас прошу!
summary: Все вроде ничего, за исключением нескольких но

description: Наконец то тундербёрду отличная альтернатива появилась!
Требует регистрации у себя в сервисе. То есть я просто не могу добавить свою почту.
Запускается быстрей. Выглядет лучше.

Шикарный клиент электропочты, пользовался раньше, пока не запретили в бесплатной версии добавлять больше одного аккаунта.
8 зелёных в месяц - это ппц как жирно.
В топку.
Перестал работать с Яндекс почтой!!

В вечном обновлении уже несколько дней причем по сети активного скачивания не наблюдается.
Куча рабочего времени потрачена в надежде что заработает и в итоге ничего. Зря потраченные деньги((((
summary: Не обновляет большой объем почты exchange

description: лучший почтовый клиент
Во-первых эта шняга требует регистрации. Во-вторых, так и не смог подключиться к рабочей почте на office 365.

Отлично. Просто отлично!
Современный интерфейс, сбор почты с всех почтовых ящиков в общие папки, работа онлайн (не загружает всю почту с ящиков на диск, экономя место), темы, настройки, куча всего - топовый клиент!
В текущей версии есть возможность отказаться от создания ихнего облачного id и работать исключительно с своими учётками. Все косяки подправили, скорость работы - космос!
Лучший почтовик, без вариантов!
P.S.: На убунту, кстати, можно сделать автостарт в иконку трея - просто добавьте в автозагрузку команду: mailspring -b
summary: Лучшее, современное приложение для работы с электропочтой!

description: Рекоменду к использованию
KDE Neon. При нажатии на ярлык запуска просто ничего не происходит.
Удобный, красивый, хорошо синхронизируется с почтовыми сервисами
Обычный клиент, но не удобно что учётные записи по отдельности, а не списком. Чобы посмтореть почту учётки нужно прям её выбрать и тогда смотреть.
Довольно неплохой почтовый клиент с приятным интерфейсом. Добавить почту без регичтрации в сервисе можно это если у кого-то возникли с этим проблемы.

вообще приложение хорошее, на другом рабочем ноуте пользовался и проблем вроде не было. Но на этом - зависает рандомно, то просто когда список писем листаешь, то когда пишешь письмо, то еще что, и при зависании виснет вообще все, приходится перезагружать ноут вообще. Такого быть не должно.
Лучшее из того, что я видел для ubuntu
I admit the GUI is the best I have seen on snap store, but a mail app which couldn't sync the mails is not a mail app AT ALL. The funny thing is I actually got the mail mailspring team sent me.
not even sync function working, who cares others

version 1.7.1
Encountered an error while syncing XX@XX.com
summary: Encountered an error while syncing XX@XX.com

description: 页面漂亮,操作简单,暂时没有发现什么bug,能够自己后台接收邮件,比thunderbird要强
登录第三方邮箱，链接上服务器之后直接显示空白页面

gui最好的email应用，各种功能也很正常。
snap版本不支持background开机自启动，如果用gnome设置开机启动会自动打开窗口。貌似deb版没有这个问题
can not connect network
收件箱总共有1000多邮件，但是只能显示两封。需要不停的更新缓存
Log shows Mailspring couldn't create the (sub)folder "Mailspring/Snoozed". The email server provider I used not support to create a sub folder.
挺美观的
All chinese characthers will be displayed as 口口口口口
